glsa.title: Xpdf, GPdf, CUPS, Poppler: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xpdf, GPdf, CUPS and Poppler potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Xpdf and GPdf are PDF file viewers that run under the X Window System. Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on Xpdf code. The Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) is a cross-platform print spooler. It makes use of Xpdf code to handle PDF files.

description.p: infamous41md discovered that several Xpdf functions lack sufficient boundary checking, resulting in multiple exploitable buffer overflows.

impact.p: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially-crafted PDF file which would trigger an overflow, potentially resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running Xpdf, CUPS, GPdf or Poppler.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
